uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.objects

Interface Car

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCar, LargeCar, SmallCar

    public interface Car

    Car

    The Car interface. It defines the methods and properties that a car should have.
    Author:
    Jonathan Carlton

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addFuel(int fuelAmount)
      Add the given amount of fuel to the fuel tank (up to the capacity of the fuel tank).
      int drive(int kmAmount)
      Drive the car for a given number of kilometres.
      int getFuelAmount()
      Get the amount of fuel, in whole litres, currently in the cars fuel tank.
      int getFuelCapacity()
      Get the capacity, in whole litres, of the cars fuel tank.
      Registration getRegistration()
      Get the registration of the car object.
      boolean isRented()
      Check if the car is currently rented.
      boolean isTankFull()
      Indicates whether the cars fuel tank is full or not.
      void setRented(boolean rent)
      The ability to rent the car.
      int useFuel(int fuelAmount)
      The ability to use a given amount of fuel in the car.

    • Method Detail

      • getRegistration

        Registration getRegistration()
        Get the registration of the car object.
        Returns:
        The registration.
        See Also:
        Registration

      • getFuelCapacity

        int getFuelCapacity()
        Get the capacity, in whole litres, of the cars fuel tank.
        Returns:
        the maximum capacity of the fuel tank.

      • getFuelAmount

        int getFuelAmount()
        Get the amount of fuel, in whole litres, currently in the cars fuel tank.
        Returns:
        the amount of fuel remaining in the tank.

      • isTankFull

        boolean isTankFull()
        Indicates whether the cars fuel tank is full or not.
        Returns:
        true, if its full, else false.

      • addFuel

        int addFuel(int fuelAmount)
        Add the given amount of fuel to the fuel tank (up to the capacity of the fuel tank).
        Parameters:
        fuelAmount - the amount of fuel to add to the fuel tank.
        Returns:
        how much fuel was added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the parameter is a negative value.

      • drive

        int drive(int kmAmount)
        Drive the car for a given number of kilometres.
        Parameters:
        kmAmount - the amount of kilometres to travel.
        Returns:
        the amount of fuel that was consumed during the travel.

      • useFuel

        int useFuel(int fuelAmount)
        The ability to use a given amount of fuel in the car. To be used in the implementation of the drive(int kmAmount) method.
        Parameters:
        fuelAmount - the amount of fuel to consume.
        Returns:
        the amount that was actually consumed.
        See Also:
        drive(int)

      • setRented

        void setRented(boolean rent)
        The ability to rent the car.
        Parameters:
        rent - true or false

      • isRented

        boolean isRented()
        Check if the car is currently rented.
        Returns:
        true, if rented, else false.
